items.summary: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

items.title: Ex-prince Andrew leaves Windsor home as British police investigate latest Epstein revelations

items.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
items.summary: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

items.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
items.summary: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

items.title: Raymond Reddington's trial told wife Sharon Fulton was murdered for insurance money
items.summary: Raymond Reddington failed to report his wife missing for several days, changed his story multiple times and wrote a fake confession letter to the state coroner, a Perth court hears.

items.title: Illawarra man faces fresh sexual assault, choking and coercive control charges
items.summary: An Illawarra man already facing serious domestic violence charges has been given six more, including rape and coercive control.

items.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
items.summary: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

items.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
items.summary: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

items.title: Mother issues urgent appeal as WA Police call off search for missing son, Zjaequaan Sebasio
items.summary: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

items.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
items.summary: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

items.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
items.summary: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

items.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach

items.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
items.summary: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

items.summary: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

items.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training

items.summary: The Department of Defence announces plans to sell off both Leeuwin and Irwin barracks, freeing up dozens of hectares of residential land in prime Perth suburbs.

items.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
items.summary: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

items.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Queensland Police appeal for information as search continues for missing 70-year-old Dawn Wells
items.summary: A large-scale search operation is underway south of Brisbane as police intensify efforts to locate a "beloved community member" who went missing late last year.

items.title: Ley and Littleproud stand firm ahead of fresh round of Coalition reunion talks
items.summary: The Nationals leader has refused to disclose whether he will reject an offering for the Coalition to reunite with a list of conditions, including a six-month suspension from the frontbench for three Nationals senators.

items.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from rising sea levels in Geraldton
items.summary: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

items.summary: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations

items.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
items.summary: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

items.title: Survival expert praises WA family's calm decision-making during miracle Geographe Bay rescue
items.summary: "Outback Mike" Atkinson says the Appelbee family's ability to stay calm and make smart decisions was critical to their survival after they were swept out to sea off Geographe Bay.

items.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
items.summary: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.

items.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
items.summary: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

items.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
items.summary: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.

items.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison

items.summary: Former Alpine racer Jack Doohan signed with Haas as a reserve driver for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

items.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles

items.title: Sydney students tackle climate change livability as world records hottest three years

items.summary: Brisbane 2032 president Andrew Liveris says the bid budget "bears no resemblance to reality" as the financial impact of a dispersed Olympics hits home.

items.title: More than 1.5m AI bots are now socialising on Moltbook — but experts say that's not the scary part
items.summary: A social network run entirely by AI bots has attracted more than a million users — but experts warn it is not what the bots are saying that poses the true risk.

items.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
items.summary: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

items.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
items.summary: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

items.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
items.summary: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

items.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
